channel.title: go on codehakase's logs
channel.description: Recent content in go on codehakase's logs

item.title: Working with JSON in Go
item.description: Summary: I’ve worked with JSON in various programming languages in context to data exchange/communication between applications. In this article, I’ll give a brief overview of the encoding/json package in Go, and point some gotchas I’ve encountered.

item.title: Enum Stringer Interface optimisation in Go
item.description: The most idiomatic way of describing an enum type in Go is to use constants, often in conjunction with iota.

item.title: Building Small Containers for Kubernetes
item.description: The first step to deploying any app to Kubernetes, is to bundle the app in a container. There are several official, and community-backed container images for various languages and distros, and most of these containers can be really large, or sometimes contain overheads your app may never need/use.

item.title: Building a Web App With Go, Gin and React
item.description: TL;DR: In this tutorial, I’ll show you how easy it is to build a web application with Go and the Gin framework and add authentication to it.

item.title: Here's What's New In Go 1.10
item.description: Go 1.8 is one year old (Happy belated Birthday üéä üéâ) Go 1.9 is already 6 months old! Go 1.

item.title: How I Learned Golang
item.description: Go is a relatively new programming language, and nothing makes a developer go crazier than a new programming language, haha! As many new tech inventions, Go was created as an experiment.
